case_title: AVADESH KUMAR UPADHYAY vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX
complaint_summary: The case involves a dispute regarding unexplained cash credit amounting to Rs. 21,000 in the name of Sint. Memo Deyi.
investigation_summary: The Income Tax Tribunal held that the cash credit remained unexplained, leading to the current legal question being referred to the High Court.
judgment_summary: The court directed the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal to draw up a statement of the case and refer the legal question for its opinion. No orders as to costs were issued.
legal_arguments: Whether the Tribunal was right in law in holding that the cash credit in the name of Sint. Memo Deyi amounting to Rs. 21,000 remained unexplained.
summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the unexplained cash credit of Rs. 21,000 in the name of Sint. Memo Deyi, with the High Court directing the Tribunal to provide a statement and refer the legal question for its opinion.
